Bio

Hi! I am currently a second-year master student at UC San Diego, advised by Prof. Xiaolong Wang.

My research interest mainly lies in deep learning and computer vision. Recently, I work on Test Time Training (TTT), which treats each test instance as a dataset of its own and makes a model generalize better to it via self-supervision at test time.

From my study of TTT I became particularly interested in developing

  • Models that reframe generalization as learning and are adaptable during deployment;
  • Self-supervised methods that leverage learning and can scale with data and computation;
  • Systems that support such methods with high parallelism and low latency.
